$DOGE dropped about 5% in the last day as the overall crypto market turned cautious, hitting smaller coins especially hard. Fewer traders were active, so selling had a bigger impact, while Bitcoin held up better as investors played it safe. At the same time, new Dogecoin tokens entered circulation, increasing supply when demand was already weak. On the charts, key support levels broke, which triggered more selling from traders who rely on technical signals. Altogether, a risk-averse market, extra supply, and negative price patterns combined to push DOGE lower.

$DOGE /USDT ‚Äì Forming Potential Bottom at Key Horizontal Support. DOGE is currently trading at $0.11842 USDT, consolidating directly at a major multi-month horizontal support zone around $0.116‚Äì$0.120 after a sharp correction from mid-December highs near $0.160+.  Price action on the 4H timeframe shows prolonged downside with lower highs, but recent candles display tight compression and early higher lows right on this demand area,classic seller exhaustion signals with potential reversal setup emerging as price respects the level amid low holiday volume.  A confirmed close above $0.124 with expanding volume would validate buyer strength, potentially targeting $0.130‚Äì$0.135 resistance. Failure to hold $0.116‚Äì$0.120 could open deeper downside toward extended supports.  Key Levels  Support zone: $0.116‚Äì$0.120 (multi-month pivot, currently testing) Reversal trigger: $0.124 (close above with volume) Upside targets: $0.130‚Äì$0.135 Deeper support: dynamic lower (~$0.110‚Äì$0.112)  Traders should monitor volume confirmation near support before positioning. Dogecoin whales have dumped about 150 million DOGE in the last days of December, pushing price below key support as weak ETF demand and a broader meme coin selloff weigh on the market.  Key points Price action: DOGE dropped to around 0.123 dollars on 31 December, its lowest level since November 2024 and roughly 61% below its late‚ÄëNovember peak near 0.48 dollars. ‚Äã Whale selling: Large holders offloaded about 150 million DOGE over five days near the bottom of the recent range, signalling de‚Äërisking rather than a full exit, as some coins were absorbed by other big players and liquidity providers. ‚Äã Support break: Selling pressure pushed DOGE below a critical 0.1248 dollar support on 30 December, with trading volume about 157% above average, showing an aggressive active sell‚Äëoff, not just thin liquidity.  ETF and demand Weak ETFs: The new Grayscale Dogecoin Trust and Bitwise Dogecoin ETF have attracted only about 2 million dollars of inflows and around 5 million dollars in total assets since launch in November, versus roughly 1.1 billion dollars into XRP‚Äëfocused funds in the same period. ‚Äã  Lack of interest: This underperformance ‚Äúreflects a lack of market interest in Dogecoin,‚Äù with Grayscale‚Äôs GDOG holding only about 3.8 million dollars as of 30 December, well below early expectations. ‚Äã  Market context Derivatives: DOGE futures open interest has fallen from about 5.2 billion dollars earlier this year to roughly 1.48 billion dollars, while daily futures volume collapsed from 60 billion dollars in November to around 2.85 billion dollars and funding has turned negative, showing bearish leveraged sentiment. ‚Äã  Meme sector slump: The whole meme coin sector‚Äôs market cap is down about 65% from a roughly 100 billion dollar 2024 peak to around 36 billion dollars, with tokens like Shiba Inu, Dogwifhat and Official Trump all down more than 60% from recent highs.  $DOGE

I‚Äôve been trading for a while, and one thing that always bothered me was how many apps I had to use. Crypto on one app, stocks on another, and sometimes another just to check prices. I‚Äôve even missed a move because I wasn‚Äôt on the right app at the right time.  Recently I noticed that Bitget lets you trade TradFi alongside crypto. The ‚Äúone app is all you need‚Äù idea actually makes sense. Being able to check something like $AAPL  while also watching $DOGE  in the same place feels way easier than juggling everything separately.  Honestly, it just makes me wonder how much time I‚Äôve wasted switching between apps before  #BTC Price Analysis#  #Macro Insights#  #Altcoin Season#

Only if price breaks and holds above 0.123 with strong continuation. Without that, upside remains capped.

What 2026 Has in Store for Dogecoin Price: 400% Rally to $0.65?   Expert Forecast: Analyst Javon Marks predicts $DOGE   could rally 400% to $0.65 in 2026.  Undervalued Potential: DOGE has long traded at low price thresholds, leaving room for upside.  Market Sentiment: Enthusiasts see DOGE as one of the most promising coins yet to show full strength.  Central Question: Can DOGE finally unlock its potential and deliver a breakout year?  Analysis Dogecoin has spent much of its history consolidating at lower price levels, often dismissed as a meme coin despite its strong community backing. The forecast by Javon Marks suggests 2026 could mark a turning point, with DOGE potentially surging to $0.65  a move that would represent a 400% rally from current levels.  Whether this prediction holds depends on broader market conditions, liquidity inflows, and renewed retail enthusiasm. DOGE‚Äôs ability to sustain momentum will also hinge on its utility expansion and continued cultural relevance.  The coming year may reveal if #Dogecoin  can transition from meme status to a serious contender in the crypto market.  #Meme Alpha#  #Altcoin Season#

Momentum is capped here ‚Äî unless DOGE can break and hold above $0.130‚Äì$0.135 with conviction, the bias favors a correction. A failure to hold current levels could drag price back toward the $0.121 ‚Üí $0.116 USDT support range.  üìå Key Levels:  Current price: $0.124  Resistance zones: $0.130 ‚Üí $0.135 ‚Üí $0.140  Support targets: $0.121 ‚Üí $0.116  Structure: short-term rise ‚Üí resistance test ‚Üí possible rejection  This is a decision-zone setup ‚Äî DOGE is approaching resistance, and the next move will define whether bulls extend higher or bears take control.  #DOGE  #Macro Insights#  #Altcoin Season#  #Bullish  #Meme Alpha#
